definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to arrange/to line up/file/series/(in data tables) column/(Tw) row
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: The study of Marxism-Leninism will arm the intellectuals ideologically.
sentences.chinese: 学习马列主义将从思想上武装知识分子。

sentences.english: It is common occurrence that now young teachers lack in accomplishment of Marxism-Leninism.
sentences.chinese: 青年教师缺乏马列主义修养是一个比较普遍的现象。

sentences.english: The October Revolution brought Marxism-Leninism to China.
sentences.chinese: 十月革命给中国带来了马列主义。

sentences.english: This point has been forcibly expressed also by marxist-leninists.
sentences.chinese: 这一点也已由马列主义者强有力地表达了出来。

sentences.english: Han Chinese Marxism-Leninism theory of professional and graduate, double-major.
sentences.chinese: 汉族，马列主义理论专业和中文专业毕业，双学历。

sentences.english: This is far from Marxism-Leninism compared with Confucianism.
sentences.chinese: 这是马列主义远远不能同儒学相比的。

sentences.english: China may claim to be Marxist-Leninist, but it’s really market-Leninist.
sentences.chinese: 中国所奉行的马列主义，实际上是市场列宁主义。

sentences.english: These Marxist- Leninist principles should be kept in mind and acted on.
sentences.chinese: 这些马列主义原则应当牢记并贯彻实行。

sentences.english: Marxism-Leninism can help solve the problem of nationalities throughout the world.
sentences.chinese: 在世界上，马列主义是能够解决民族问题的。

pinyin: Ma3 ke4 si1 Lie4 ning2 zhu3 yi4

definition: Manifesto of the Communist Party/"Manifest der Kommunistischen Partei" by Marx and Engels (1848)
Deng Xiaoping Theory/Dengism/the foundation of PRC economic development after the Cultural Revolution, building the capitalist economy within Chinese Communist Party control
On New Democracy (1940), by Mao Zedong
pinyin: Xin1 Min2 zhu3 zhu3 yi4 Lun4

definition: abbr. for Marx 馬克思|马克思[Ma3 ke4 si1], Engels 恩格斯[En1 ge2 si1], Lenin 列寧|列宁[Lie4 ning2] and Stalin 斯大林[Si1 da4 lin2]
